item.description: Identifies when a new cloudshell is created inside of Azure portal.

item.description: Detects spawning of suspicious child processes by Atlassian Confluence server which may indicate successful exploitation of CVE-2021-26084

item.description: Detects process patterns found in Cobalt Strike beacon activity (see reference for more details)

item.description: Detects a suspicious script executions from temporary folder

item.description: This events that are generated when using the hacktool Ruler by Sensepost

item.description: Detects multiple suspicious process in a limited timeframe

item.description: Detects suspicious process related to rasdial.exe

item.description: Detects suspicious sysprep process start with AppData folder as target (as used by Trojan Syndicasec in Thrip report by Symantec)

item.title: CVE-2021-40444 Process Pattern
item.description: Detects a suspicious process pattern found in CVE-2021-40444 exploitation

item.title: Fsutil Behavior Set SymlinkEvaluation
item.description: A symbolic link is a type of file that contains a reference to another file. This is probably done to make sure that the ransomware is able to follow shortcuts on the machine in order to find the original file to encrypt

item.title: Lateral Movement Indicator ConDrv
item.description: This event was observed on the target host during lateral movement. The process name within the event contains the process spawned post compromise. Account Name within the event contains the compromised user account name. This event should to be correlated with 4624 and 4688 for further intrusion context.

item.title: Monitoring Winget For LOLbin Execution
item.description: Adversaries can abuse winget to download payloads remotely and execute them without touching disk. Winget will be included by default in Windows 10 and is already available in Windows 10 insider programs. The manifest option enables you to install an application by passing in a YAML file directly to the client. Winget can be used to download and install exe’s, msi, msix files later.

item.title: PCRE.NET Package Image Load
item.description: Detects processes loading modules related to PCRE.NET package

item.title: PCRE.NET Package Temp Files
item.description: Detects processes creating temp files related to PCRE.NET package

item.description: Detects process command line patterns and locations used by REvil group in Kaseya incident (can also match on other malware)

item.title: Run PowerShell Script from Redirected Input Stream
item.description: Detects PowerShell script execution via input stream redirect

item.title: Script Interpreter Execution From Suspicious Folder
item.description: Detects a suspicious script executions in temporary folders or folders accessible by environment variables

item.title: Suspicious Execution from Outlook
item.description: Detects EnableUnsafeClientMailRules used for Script Execution from Outlook

item.description: Detects renamed ftp.exe, ftp.exe script execution and child processes ran by ftp.exe

item.title: Suspicious Runscripthelper.exe
item.description: Detects execution of powershell scripts via Runscripthelper.exe

item.title: Turla Group Lateral Movement
item.description: Detects automated lateral movement by Turla group

item.title: VMToolsd Suspicious Child Process
item.description: Detects suspicious child process creations of VMware Tools process which may indicate persistence setup

item.title: Writing Of Malicious Files To The Fonts Folder
item.description: Monitors for the hiding possible malicious files in the C:\Windows\Fonts\ location. This folder doesn’t require admin privillege to be written and executed from.
